snippet: Carl Levin, chairman of the Senate Armed Services Committee, said he would exclude the measure offered by Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand, a fellow Democrat.
abstract: Senate Armed Services Committee chairman Carl Levin says he will remove measure aimed at curbing sexual assault in military from defense spending bill; Sen Kirsten E Gillibrand offered measure that would give military prosecutors rather than commanders power to decide which sexual assault crimes to try, aiming to increase reporting of crimes without fear of retaliation.
lead_paragraph: Carl Levin, chairman of the Senate Armed Services Committee, said he would exclude the measure offered by Senator Kirsten E. Gillibrand, a fellow Democrat.

headline.seo: A Measure to Curb Sexual Assault in Military to Be Cut From Bill
headline.main: A Sexual-Assault Measure to Be Cut From Military Bill
headline.print_headline: Sexual-Assault Measure to Be Cut From Military Bill

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
